primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The movement of Jesus from the agony of Gethsemane to the abandonment of the Cross to effect the deliverance of humanity from sin and condemnation.

tekstueel_bewijs: Jesus... began to be greatly distressed
he proceeded to relinquish every form of power
he was preparing to shoulder a weight
he gives his own person to us
to deliver you and me from the condemnation
the overwhelming joy of our deliverance

zender.identificatie: God the Father (acting in unity with the Son)
tekstueel_bewijs: the Father and the Son acting together, with one will
gives his own person to us

helper.identificatie: The Holy Spirit (implied) and the Evangelist Mark
tekstueel_bewijs: the Lord is moving in your heart to draw you to himself
Mark wanted his readers to understand
the dread of the Godforsakenness of sin
a weight not only of death, but of God’s eternal condemnation
tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: The opponent is not merely bad behavior but ontological abandonment and eternal condemnation.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The hearer's response of repentance and identification with the 'Crucify him' cry.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: The Hearer
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The hearer's action is a response to the primary action of Christ; it is the 'opening' to receive what has already been won.

voorbeelden_god_subject: God made Jesus to be sin
Jesus... gives his own person to us
the Son of God bore away from us

voorbeelden: we must work hard at recovering
Mark wanted his readers to understand
makes it happen, in his own person

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon focuses on Christ's 'ability' to bear the weight that humans cannot, shifting the burden of performance from the hearer to the Substitute.

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: The sermon moves from the false security of 'not saying Crucify him' (not-S2) into the reality of Dereliction (S2) through Christ, to reach Deliverance (S1).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: Christ occupies S2 (Dereliction) so the hearer can move from ~S1 to S1.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: Extremely high; the 'Cry of Dereliction' is the structural pivot.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: The sermon is profoundly theocentric. It identifies Christ as the sole actor capable of handling the 'Heavy Opponent' (Sin/Abandonment).

indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: give ourselves to him without reservation

indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: the Son of God bore away from us
the Lord is moving in your heart

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: Jesus is specifically contrasted with human examples like Socrates to show he is doing something no human can do.
bijbelse_figuren_als_model: The Centurion (as a model of recognition, not performance)

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Relief and awe; the pressure to be 'righteous' is removed by the admission of solidarity in sin.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The title perfectly mirrors the actantial movement: His Dereliction (Subject's struggle) = Our Deliverance (Receiver's benefit).

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: Jesus, the representative man, our substitute... delivers you and me from the condemnation

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: The Spirit provides the 'willingness' (Vouloir) to enter the Passion.

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: Critical; sin results in total Godforsakenness.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The sermon maintains a rigorous focus on Christ as the Subject of the primary narrative program, relegating human action to a secondary, responsive program.

identificatie_herstel.strategie: Maintain the current focus on the hearer as the beneficiary of the 'staggering event'.

modale_balans.voorgestelde_balans: Maintain as is; this is the essence of a Gospel sermon.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: This is a masterclass in grace-oriented preaching. It avoids the trap of exemplarism by highlighting the unique, non-repeatable work of Christ as the Subject.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: A rhetorical analysis might focus on the 'Abba' vs 'Eloi' contrast; Greimas shows these are modal markers of the Subject's transition from Devoir to Performance.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis explains Mark's intent; Greimas shows how the sermon functions as a 'delivery system' of the Object to the Receiver.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Reveals that the 'woman who wouldn't say Crucify him' is structurally trying to remain a 'Subject' of her own righteousness rather than becoming a 'Receiver' of mercy.

volledige_subject_lijst: God (Subject) made Jesus to be sin
appendices.notities: The sermon successfully utilizes Fleming Rutledge's grammar of grace by keeping God/Christ as the active Subject of the salvific verbs.
